abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Economic Reform
            and Development Loan Project in Jordan are as follows:
            overall outcome of the project was rated highly
            satisfactory, and the performance of the Bank and the
            Borrower were rated satisfactory. The success of this
            operation provides a good example of close collaboration
            with the borrower during the design and implementation
            phases. The program design was made comprehensive enough for
            the government to adopt it as its own medium-term
            development agenda which could also be used in addressing
            the concerns of a number of other key development partners
            of Jordan. Since the reform program had been implicitly
            endorsed by the International Monetary Fund (IMF), the
            European Community and other major donors, its justification
            and rationalization were no longer the issues to be resolved.
